SourcedStatement: This announcement comes as Secretary Cardona is embarking on his 2024 Back to School Bus Tour with stops in Wisconsin, Illinois, Indiana, Michigan, and Pennsylvania.
Name: U.S. Department of Education
Justification: The announcement coincides with Secretary Cardona's 2024 Back to School Bus Tour, highlighting the Department's commitment to public education.

SourcedStatement: The 2024 Bus Tour will celebrate public education as the American system that opened the door for so many of our nation’s success stories—from astronauts to astrophysicists, writers to engineers, musician mathematicians, innovative entrepreneurs in the private sector to great leaders in the public sector.
Name: U.S. Department of Education
Justification: The 2024 Bus Tour celebrates public education as a cornerstone of American success stories across various fields.

SourcedStatement: “Being multilingual is a superpower—a powerful asset that can connect students to their identity and culture, and gives those who speak more than one language cognitive, social, and economic benefits,” said U.S. Secretary of Education Miguel Cardona, “The investments we’re announcing today advance our goal of providing every student in America with a pathway to multilingualism by supporting the recruitment, preparation, and retention of amazing bilingual and multilingual educators—some of the best teachers in our nation, period. They also support the revitalization of Native American languages, a reflection of this Administration’s commitment to Tribal sovereignty and consultation in education.”
Name: Miguel Cardona
Title: U.S. Secretary of Education
Justification: U.S. Secretary of Education Miguel Cardona emphasized the benefits of multilingualism and the importance of the investments in supporting bilingual and multilingual educators and revitalizing Native American languages.

SourcedStatement: On Tuesday, the U.S. Department of Education (Department) announced over $11 million in grants to support the recruitment and retention of bilingual and multilingual educators and provide high quality programming to Native students in an effort to strengthen and revitalize Native American languages.
Name: U.S. Department of Education
Justification: The U.S. Department of Education announced over $11 million in grants to support the recruitment and retention of bilingual and multilingual educators and provide high quality programming to Native students.

SourcedStatement: Today’s announcements include $7.5 million in 13 new awards in the National Professional Development program (NPD) to support educators of English learners.
Name: U.S. Department of Education
Justification: The U.S. Department of Education announced $7.5 million in 13 new awards in the National Professional Development program (NPD) to support educators of English learners.

SourcedStatement: The Department also announced $3.7 million in grant funding for the Native American Language (NAL@ED) projects.
Name: U.S. Department of Education
Justification: The U.S. Department of Education announced $3.7 million in grant funding for the Native American Language (NAL@ED) projects.
